page.title: 01Local History
page.content: Ditchingham has been in existence sincethe first Domesday.There is evi- dence of occupation in the Bronze Age. The Romans grew fruit on the south facing slopes of the Vineyard Hills by the River Waveney.A spring below these hills resulted in a spa in the l73Os. Today Ditchingham is a growing lively village but no industry or fame. New housing estate names recall past resi- dents of note: Lewis Close for a much- loved parson of the l96Os;Rider Hag- ard Way for the Victorian author and agriculturist.The church has screen porch & window restored as a memorial to him.The village of l985 is l/4 mile away from its earlier site. In l96l a Parish Newsletter was begun.With diary activity reports, church service times and articles of local and general in- terest it links residents in a vital way in these days of village decline.
